page.title: 17Sparham Church
page.content: The 15'th century tower of St. Mary's church is a landmark in the Wensum valley. Sparham is one of four parishes in the care of one rector, the others being Elsing, Bylaugh and Lyng where the modern rectory is situated. Church and village news is circulated through the four parishes by the duplicated magazine "Hill and Vale" (Sparham on the hill, the others in the valley) A growing interest in campanology has led to the revival of bell ringing in Sparham where the three bells, cast in 1726, were rung again for the 1985 Harvest Festival. Future hopes are that 2 lighter bells will be found to replace those sold in 1776 to make a complete ring of 5 again and an upper floor will be installed in the tower to facilitate ringing and encourage more Sparham folk to take up this art
